meanings.definition: To cause to flow or flood
meanings.sent1: She flushes the toilet after using it.
meanings.sent2: The heavy rain flushes the streets with water.
meanings.sent3: The burst pipe flushes the basement with water, making it a swimming pool.
meanings.sent4: The waterfall flushes down the rocks with great force.
meanings.sent5: The dam opening suddenly flushes the valley with water, creating a flood.

meanings.definition: To become red in the face from embarrassment or anger
meanings.sent1: He flushes with embarrassment when he realizes his mistake.
meanings.sent2: She flushes every time someone compliments her.
meanings.sent3: The little girl flushes when caught eating cookies before dinner.
meanings.sent4: His face flushes like a ripe tomato when he gets angry.
meanings.sent5: The shy boy flushes whenever he has to speak in front of the class.

meanings.definition: A sudden rush of emotion or excitement
meanings.sent1: The unexpected win brought a flush of joy to her face.
meanings.sent2: A flush of excitement spread through the crowd as the band took the stage.
meanings.sent3: The surprise party caused a flush of happiness in the birthday girl.
meanings.sent4: A flush of fear washed over him as he heard a loud noise in the dark.
meanings.sent5: The news of the promotion brought a flush of pride to his cheeks.

meanings.definition: To clean out by a rapid flow of water
meanings.sent1: She flushes the dirt out of the wound with water.
meanings.sent2: The plumber flushes the clogged pipe to clear it.
meanings.sent3: The heavy rain flushes the debris off the streets.
meanings.sent4: The strong current flushes the pollutants out of the river.
meanings.sent5: The irrigation system flushes the soil with water to remove salt buildup.
